prompt:
I received an award for being exceptionally dedicated and quick to learn while creating above average work. I was lucky to have a manager that recognized my skills, attention to detail, and focus. I'm a great employee and asset to most companies, so I'm not surprised I earned the award, but I am surprised that I was given it, because so often people don't notice the work others put in. I'm happy to know that the effort I put in is deemed sufficient for recognition and hopeful that I can translate this into more career opportunities.

###

I received an award for employee of the month. I received this award due to my daily hard work and dedication to the mission of our organization. It was apparent through my organization skills and quick turnaround on work that I was a great candidate to receive this award. I feel very proud to receive such an award.

###

I would like to receive an award in compassion. That I consider all people and that I am kind to people in all ways. I want to do something meaningful to help people and that makes something in their lives easier.

###

I have received an award for training a rescue dog. The dog came from a neglectful home and had never had proper human interaction or training. I used repetition and positive reinforcement and lots of treats to train the dog to walk on a leash, come when called, and behave herself. I feel satisfied but also undeserving for receiving the award; I am not a professional dog trainer, and there are a lot of things I do not know about dog training.

###

If I were to receive an award, it was most likely an award for being an experienced & high quality research coordinator with the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation. I was able to achieve this award by working hard at my job, earning the ACRP certification, and working on advanced studies for years and giving back to the CF community. I feel extremely honored to receive the award. I wonder if I was the most appropriate person to be awarded it, but am humbled by the experience. I would be very proud of the accomplishment, and would show it off at work on my desk in my office!

###

If I have to pick an award I would say its an award for being helpful/instructive in teaching someone something. I would appreciate the award's purpose and message, but I would feel uncomfortable about getting the award because I don't want the attention. I hope the award or recognition is earned by my ability to help others better their ability to do something.

###

I imagine that I receive a wellness award at work. The award was for, perhaps, completing a challenge related to running, or steps, or eating healthy. I was able to achieve the award because I spend a lot of time doing these things. I feel good about this award because my efforts were recognized.

###

I have just received an award for being with my employer for 10 years. I was able to acheive this award by loving the place I work at and enjoying what I do. I fell proud and excited to get this reward because it will be a great accomplishment in my life. I will feel fulfilled when hitting a milestone such as this.

###

I won an award at work for leading a complicated project to completion despite significant deadline pressure and a host of other obstacles. I was able to achieve this by being focused and not getting distracted. I recognized what I needed to do and what everyone else on the team needed to do, and delegated tasks accordingly. I feel lukewarm about the award itself, but happy that I got it because award-winning employees have the best economic security. This means that I can feel secure in my position at work.

###

If I receive an award in anything, it would be in my chosen field of clinical psychology, and I hope it would be an award for my clinical skill and rapport with my clients. I would have received the award because I made person-centered care my priority. I would be proud to be recognized by my clients because it would show that they value the work we do together, and that their lives have been improved.

###

My imaginary award is for dedication to either my job or something to that nature. Willingness to stay and stick around and see something through to the end even if it means staying late or working hard on something. I would feel good about the recognition, but would want to make sure to play up other team members contributions to the project, or other similar acts that didn't get recognition.

###

I imagine I would receive the award for my involvement in a local volunteer program. I was able to achieve the award by consistently participating in volunteer efforts, even when it was difficult due to pressure from other obligations. I was also able to acheive the award by taking advantage of the program's existing infrastructure that helped me begin as a volunteer 6 years ago and, over time, rise to a leadership position in the coordinating committee. I would feel happy about getting the award, but it would not be as important to me as the time actually spent volunteering.

###

If I received an award, it would probably be related to public health/HIV research. I try to always look at a new question or angle (I guess that's kind of what research is...), so it could be related to that. I also really care about research integrity and being able to explain decisions/why certain things were that way, so it could also be related to that. It's nice to receive awards, and I would be happy, but I typically don't need that as validation. Just knowing that your work might be making an impact (however small) is rewarding enough for me.

###

I received an award for being a dedicated, hard worker. I achieved this award because I am always willing to learn more. I go out of my way everyday to help my coworkers and also with assisting the clients I see every day. I feel appreciated. I feel as though my efforts are being seen and recognized.

###

I received an award in loving-kindness & in advocating & organizing for my community. I was able to achieve this by listening to the needs of my community, collaborating with skilled people around me, and committing to the cause. I feel wonderful about getting it, but what matters most is accomplishing my mission & making sure that those in my community feel that I have truly succeeded in my mission.

###

I imagine that I would receive an award work that I did and my contribution to something. I am very hard-working and dedicated so I think that if I would get an award it would be for something like that. I would feel very proud and accomplished to get an award that I worked hard for.

###

I have received an award for bettering women's lives through medicine. I was able to apply my medical knowledge to be able to give back to the other 50% of the population on earth that is often not made to be important. I am grateful to receive it and would want to continue further advancements. It is important to get recognition, because it allows you to work harder for the ultimate goal.

###

I have just received an award as an outstanding employee or something to that nature. I was able to achieve this award by paying close attention to details so that I have had very few mistakes, putting in long hours often outside of the normal 9-5 to make sure I am prepared and am accomplishing all tasks, and I have gone the extra mile to really make my work more exceptional than others who just do the bare minimum. I feel extremely proud of myself, my efforts and how I pushed myself because it was all worth it.

###

I received the award for going above and beyond the expected by contributing additional time and effort to a team effort so that everyone could accomplish something meaningful in our profession. I am honored and humbled to receive the award. I re-read the email announcement of the award multiple times including checking to be sure it's not spam and that it is specifically written to me. I feel very excited but also insecure and hoping that others will affirm the success and that they feel I deserve the award. I am looking to others around me to cheer for me but am unsure of the response that I will receive and whether I should have been chosen. I don't usually get recognized for my enthusiasm and work ethic, so in part, it feels like something will turn sour very soon.

###

If i were to receive an award it would likely relate to my job. I have a strong work ethic, set strong goals for myself, and interact well with others. My manager would have noticed how well i had taken on a new task and nominated me as a result.

###

I received the award in helping the research study I work on meet their study goals. I was able to achieve it through determination to get the job done as well as I can and with the help of all of those on my team. I feel like it's too little too late and don't take it seriously. I think they give awards to those who seem the most frustrated with work instead of those who actually deserve the awards (others on my team that have performed well beyond their job duties for months-years).

###

Fitness program award.for the month. Work out at least 3 times a week and each time last more than 30 minutes. Because I participate in a fitness challenge program in the past two months and I really try to go to gym as much as possible. The gym provide childcare service, so I can go workout while letting my older kid play there. I feel very happy that I accomplish it although it's hard to leave the little one with her Dad while I go workouting at the gym. I feel healthy that I workout regullary

###

Excellence in my trade. I was able to achieve it by constantly educating myself and working extremely hard. I feel thrilled about getting it because I work very hard to stay on top of things and do great at my job.

###

I imagine receiving an award related to my job, some kind of recognition for accomplishing a goal. I was able to achieve this through hard work and making an effort to be recognized/communicating the commitment I have made. I feel pride and confidence receiving the award.

###

I received the award for my work in research and the success of our research study to help elderly adults live a more fulfilling, safer and happier time. I was able to achieve this by showing great results and data through the research my team created. I feel honored and excited to receive it.

###

I am being recognized for stepping up in my work place and taking responsibility for a project where I went above and beyond what was asked of me. I took on the extra responsibility because the work was asked of my office and it had to be one of us (the managers weren't stepping up) and, of my coworkers, we are all equally busy. It is very satisfying to be recognized for such hard work and putting in the extra time but it would be a little awkward/I would feel somewhat guilty because, while I did take on the majority of the work, I was not the only one to contribute. It was ultimately a group effort and we should all be recognized.

###

i received the award for my academic achievement. I worked really hard for it. I did what needed to be done. I completely feel I deserve it. I will keep doing the good work so that I can be the best at what I do.

###

I received an award for all the hard work in the office. I have put a lot of effort into the work that I do and other people in my office noticed my efforts. I feel really great feeling it, but the best part is when someone recognized my efforts so much so that they advocated for me to get this award.

###

I received an award in being hardworking and determined. This award highlights the work that I do in my field and bringing awareness to issues facing a certain population of people. Although I don't like being the center of attention, it does make me feel good to be recognized for my hardwork.

###

I received the award for outstanding leadership in my work. I was able to achieve this award because I not only guided people through tasks, I listened to their concerns and was invested in both them and our shared projects. I also worked very hard on our shared projects myself, and didn't just delegate tasks. I feel very proud and happy about receiving the award.

###

I received an award for creating the most impactful change in the fight against global economic injustice. I was able to achieve that award through many years of perseverance, collaboration with people who have the same vision, and faithfully following God.

###

I received an award in outstanding service in the library field. I achieved the award through hard work and enthusiasm for my position and always being willing to help out anyone who needed it. I feel good about getting the award because I have worked hard to get where I'm at.

###

I would have just received an award for community service/volunteer work in the community. I am active in several organizations and independent community service and have so for awhile. I would feel pleased with getting the award although don't feel that I need to be honored or awarded for something that one could be doing regardless.

###

I received the award for my collaboration with others on campus. I was able to achieve it through the hard work and time I put into fostering relationships with others. I am excited to be recognized.

###

I would receive an award in helping co-workers. I was able to achieve this by always trying to help when I see that one of my co-workers has a lot on their plate or they are running behind and a little bit of help would make things easier for them. Receiving this award would make me feel happy that others noticed that I try to help if I can.

I achieved an award in collaboration and communication. I was able to achieve it by bringing together multiple stakeholders and achieving things that had not been done before. If it were for a one time achievement it may feel less good than if it was a reoccurring program or something like that.

I received the award for my accomplishments at work. I earned it through hard work and dedication to my career and for my success at balancing my personal life and a job I love. I feel really proud of myself and grateful for my loved ones who are willing to celebrate my accomplishments.

I have achieved an award for helping my home country improve its quality of life, it is no longer a third world country but is on its way to becoming a first world country. I go back to my home country and strive to make positive changes for the greater good; my country will no longer be over populated or be under severe economical stress.

###

In this fantasy, I am being recognized for excellence in writing about my observations about society. I would be appreciative for the reward, and would feel a strong sense of validation, as writing is very important to me, and I consider myself to be a good writer. I understand that my ability to write is entirely thanks to the opportunities afforded to me by my privileged upbringing, and that I am lucky to have met at a young age people who inspired me to look critically at systems and think broadly and abstractly. I think this award, like all awards, ultimately celebrates a very specific type of person for excellence as judged by a very specific type of criteria, which are far from universal, and which was almost invariably conceived and evaluated by people who look and think like me, and who generally share my perceptions/opinions about which types of knowledge/excellence are inherently the most valuable.

The most likely scenario that I would receive an award for would be in a work capacity after presenting results. I'd be able to achieve this by spending my time at work efficiently and getting tasks done, and guiding others in their ability to also accomplish tasks. I would feel proud and happy.

If I won an award, I imagine it being received for academic achievement and it will have given me some sort of scholarship or prize money in addition to the award. I probably won't be receiving any awards any time soon. HOWEVER, if I am to receive an award at some point during my lifetime, it would probably be either in peacemaking or something in my career field (probably policy making or the legal side of the sciences/mental health).

I received an award for being a good member of the staff. I feel gratified because I feel that I work hard and am proud to have earned this recognition. I achieved the award by working diligently and having a good attitude.

I received an award for my work with students. I was able to achieve this award by being a passionate educator. I feel great about this award. This award makes me want to do even more and be better and better.
